intro: Mimulopsis lyalliana var. diffusa, commonly known as the lyall's mimulopsis, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, urn-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
